titlestmt.titleproper: Ruth Priest Dixon research materials on seamen's protection certificate applications 1990-1998
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Ruth Priest Dixon research materials on seamen's protection certificate applications
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Ruth Priest Dixon (1922-2004) worked as a volunteer for the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) and compiled a three-volume index of early merchant seamen records. She received her M.A. in political science from George Washington University.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, notes, photocopies and printed materials related to Ruth Priest Dixon's research for her published indexes to seaman's protections certificate applications held in the National Archives. Research concerns applications for the ports of Philadelphia, New Orleans, Mobile (Alabama), New Haven (Connecticut), and Bath (Maine).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
